questions.text: What does the slope coefficient in a regression equation represent?

options.label: A

options.label: B

questions.text: What is a potential consequence of “lead time bias” in assessing the effectiveness of a screening program?

options.text: Underestimation of the benefits of early detection

options.label: B
options.text: Overestimation of the benefits of early detection

options.label: C

questions.correct_answer: B. Overestimation of the benefits of early detection

questions.text: How is the area under the ROC curve (AUC) interpreted?

options.label: A
options.text: AUC of 1 indicates perfect test performance, while 0.5 suggests no discriminative ability.

options.label: B
options.text: AUC of 0.5 indicates perfect test performance, while 1 suggests no discriminative ability.

options.label: C
options.text: AUC has no interpretation in ROC analysis.

options.label: D
options.text: AUC represents the prevalence of the disease in the population.

questions.correct_answer: A. AUC of 1 indicates perfect test performance, while 0.5 suggests no discriminative ability.

The skin of the leg is cool, pale, white, and shining. Crepitus can be felt in the leg. His hematocrit is 20% (∼50% of normal), and his circulating hemoglobin is normal. options.label: A

options.label: B
options.text: The P. aeruginosa is highly susceptible to the aminoglycoside antimicrobial tobramycin.

options.label: C

questions.correct_answer: A. The P. aeruginosa has formed a biofilm in the patient’s airway

questions.text: A 27-year-old NRI man develops fever, chills, headache, and backache. Four days later he develops a high fever and jaundice. Yellow fever is diagnosed. Which of the following statements concerning yellow fever is correct?

options.label: A
options.text: The virus is transmitted by culicine mosquitoes in the urban form of disease.

options.label: B
options.text: Monkeys in the jungle are a major reservoir of yellow fever virus.

options.label: C
options.text: Yellow fever often has long-term complications.

options.label: D
options.text: All infections lead to apparent disease.

questions.correct_answer: B. Monkeys in the jungle are a major reservoir of yellow fever virus.

questions.text: A 28-year-old woman has recurrent genital blisters and ulcers as shown in the image. Which of the following statements about this infection is true?

options.label: A
options.text: Reactivation of latent virus during pregnancy poses no threat to the newborn.

options.label: B
options.text: Virus cannot be transmitted in the absence of apparent lesions.

options.label: C
options.text: Recurrent episodes caused by reactivation of latent virus tend to be more severe than the primary infection.

options.label: D
options.text: They can be caused by either herpes simplex virus type 1 or type 2.

questions.correct_answer: D. They can be caused by either herpes simplex virus type 1 or type 2.

questions.correct_answer: C. The vector for T. cruzi, the cause of Chagas’ disease, is the reduviid bug.

A mother brings her 17-year-old son for his annual health maintenance exam. When you ask if she has any concerns about him, she mentions that he sleeps all the time. She also states that he was always a happy child but recently has become more withdrawn and always seems tired. She reports that his grades have been declining, and he does not seem to enjoy activities he previously enjoyed, such as playing soccer and video games with friends. The next step in diagnosing this patient is:

options.label: A
options.text: Obtaining a CBC and iron studies.

questions.text: A 2 months old child has edema and tachycardia On examination, he has cardiomegaly with a cardiothoracic ratio of 0.67. Which vitamin deficiency can cause this?
Perioral rash, diarrhea, alopecia, frequent infections in a one year old child should raise suspicion of deficiency of
Which of the following would make Turner syndrome an unlikely diagnosis in a patient with amenorrhea?
The most common inherited bleeding disorder, which often presents as menorrhagia in adolescent females is:
Which immunodeficiency is not correctly matched with its mode of inheritance?

options.label: A
options.text: Chronic granulomatous disease-X-linked recessive and autosomal recessive.

options.label: D
options.text: Severe combined immunodeficiency (SCI-X-linked recessive and autosomal recessive.

questions.text: An 18-year-old girl injured her knee after skiing at Gulmarg. She saw her primary care physician who advised rest and icing, as well as ibuprofen if needed for pain. Thirty minutes after taking 400 mg of ibuprofen, she develops diffuse hives and swelling of her lips and eyelids. Alarmed, her family rushes her to the emergency department, where on arrival she vomits, feels short of breath, and is lightheaded. What medication should be administered first to this patient?
Which is NOT a laboratory finding of acute tumor lysis syndrome?

A term baby boy is found on day of life 1 to have petechiae in his antecubital and popliteal fossae, and around the base of the neck. A CBC reveals a platelet count of 13 x 103/mm and the platelets appear small in size on blood smear evaluation. Family history reveals that the patient has two brothers, ages 6 and 2 years; the older brother has eczema, frequent nose bleeds, bruises easily, and has been admitted to the hospital several times with bacterial pneumonia, while the other brother is healthy. The patient's mother has no chronic illness; her older brother died as a teenager from prolonged bleeding following a motorcycle accident. Which of the following additional findings would you anticipate in this patient?

options.label: A
options.text: Absence of radii on upper extremity X-rays.

options.label: B
options.text: Marked decrease in megakaryocytes on bone marrow aspirate.

options.label: C
options.text: Mutation in WAS gene on genetic testing.

options.label: D
options.text: Hyperpigmentation and microcephaly on physical exam.

questions.correct_answer: C. Mutation in WAS gene on genetic testing.

questions.text: A 9 year old has multiple itchy erythematous lesions all over the body for 2 days. There is no respiratory difficulty. Which is the best treatment?
Identify the skin condition shown below?
A female comes with frothy, green vaginal discharge of 5 day duration. There was a strawberry cervix on examination. The drug of choice?

Identify the blister pack given and mark the correct options about scheduling: A. Rifampicin 450mg once a month supervised B. Clofazimine 150 mg once a month supervised C. Dapsone 50 mg once a day unsupervised D. Clofazimine 50 mg alternate day unsupervised
A patient comes with itching in the groin since 2 months. All can cause this except?
For giving CPR, after ascertaining unresponsiveness one should
Synchronized intermittent mandatory ventilation (simv) was an improvement on Intermittent mandatory ventilation (imv) because it can:

options.label: A
options.text: Can provide full ventilation support to an apnoeic patient.

options.label: B
options.text: Can utilize volume-preset or pressure-preset ventilation.

options.label: C
options.text: Allows the patient to breathe spontaneously.

options.label: D
options.text: Reduces the likelihood of breath stacking and volutrauma

questions.correct_answer: D. Reduces the likelihood of breath stacking and volutrauma

questions.text: Neuraxial block is not contraindicated for patients on which of the following drugs?
Pulse oximetry illuminates tissue samples with two wavelengths of light in order to calculate oxygen saturation. These wavelengths are ______ nm:
A healthy pregnant patient in labour has which of the following asa classifications?
All of the following are not true about suicide except?

options.label: A
options.text: Patient who talk about suicide rarely commit suicide

options.label: B
options.text: All suicidal threats are not to be taken seriously

options.label: C
options.text: Asking about suicide will often reduce the anxiety surrounding the feeling

options.label: D
options.text: Amongst all risk factors of suicide, hopelessness is most important risk factor

questions.correct_answer: C. Asking about suicide will often reduce the anxiety surrounding the feeling

questions.text: In MMSE (Mini Mental Status examination), highest score is given to which one of the following domains tested?

A 30-year-old man was brought to the Accident andEmergency Department. He suddenly fell downafter hearing a loud sound at a party. There was noloss of consciousness. T8he psychopathology beingdescribed is:
Which of the following is not a REM sleep disorder?

A 60-year-old woman complained of depression andwas started on escitalopram. After twoweeks of treatment, she complains of lethargy, muscleweakness and nausea. Which of the following is the mostlikely cause for her symptoms:

An 8 year old boy presents with Right Hip Pain and Limping Gait for last one week. The mothers gives history of recent URTI in last month only. The examination revealed limitation of hip movements only in extremes. Blood counts are almost normal except Raised ESR. What is the diagnosis ?

A 31 year old female complains of Anterior Knee Pain with difficulty in squatting and cross legged sitting for long periods. An illustration is attached hereby. Which of the following is not true about this ?

options.label: A
options.text: Cinema Sign is clinically seen in these patients

options.label: B
options.text: There is no Osteochondral fragment seen initially

options.label: C
options.text: It is Chondromalacia Patellae which needs surgical management in most of the cases

options.label: D
options.text: Arthroscopic Biopsy is a must for diagnosis

questions.correct_answer: C. It is Chondromalacia Patellae which needs surgical management in most of the cases

questions.text: Which is not true about Congenital Muscular Torticollis ?

options.label: B
options.text: It normally present at upper 2/3 and lower 1/3 junction

options.label: C
options.text: Its associated with oligohydraminos and limb defects

questions.correct_answer: A. Its always seen at birth

questions.text: A 25-year-old man presents with severe pain in the left femur. The pain is relieved by aspirin. On plain film, a 0.5-cm lucent lesion, which is surrounded by marked reactive sclerosis, is seen. Diagnosis is:

A 14-year-old patient presents with pain in the wrist after a fall. Examination reveals tenderness over the anatomical snuff box. X-ray picture shows impacted fracture scaphoid. What is the next course of treatment?
8-year-old female patient with recent onset of acute forearm pain. What is the most likely diagnosis?
33-year-old male history withheld. What is the most likely diagnosis?
What anatomic variant is seen in this coronal bone CT image?
63-year-old male patient with progressive dyspnea on exertion and a nonproductive cough. What is the most likely diagnosis?
28-year-old male patient with fever and right upper quadrant pain. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 67-year-old woman is admitted to the casualty with pyrexia (38.1) and a cough productive of green sputum. The observations show a Pulse rate of 101/min, BP 80/60 and Respiratory rate of 32/min. She is alert and oriented in time and space. Investigations reveal TLC of 21000, Urea of 8.5 and x-ray reveals consolidation in the right lung. She is treated for CAP. Which of the following is the correct calculated CURB 65 score?

A 28-year-old Primi-gravida with 32 weeks pregnancy is brought to the casualty with sudden onset of breathlessness. She has a history of threatened abortion due to which she was on complete bed rest for the last 3 months. She had noticed pain followed by swelling in her right calf a week before. The investigation of choice to diagnose the condition would be:
questions.correct_answer: B. Radioisotope perfusion pulmonary scintigraphy (VQ scan)

questions.text: The following type of Malaria is associated with risk of Nephrotic syndrome

A 38-year-old woman has Bout onset multiple sclerosis. She has experienced two attacks of disease previously that have left her with residual lower extremity weakness. She was initially treated with glucocorticoids with some improvement in her symptoms. However, she is currently only able to walk with a rolling walker about 100 m. A prior antibody test shows that she is positive for reactivity to the JC virus. You are planning to start a disease-modifying therapy. Which of the following is LEAST appropriate for this individual?

A 32-year-old female non-smoker presented with sudden onset of cough followed by breathlessness. CXR revealed pneumothorax. She also gives history of similar episodes in the past. The most probable diagnosis is:

A post-menopausal female presented with sudden onset angina. Coronary Angiography revealed normal vessels. Ventriculography performed in this patient during systole revealed the following picture. What is the probable diagnosis:
Unstable angina is characterised by all of the following features EXCEPT:

A 45- year- old man fell on the ground with all of his extremities showing increased in tone with subsequent jerking followed by loss of consciousness . Which of the following best characterizes his new condition?
Which of the following is a red flag sign in Parkinson disease
Which of the following clinical factor is not in ABCD2 score criteria for stroke development in a patient of TIA
20-year female comes with pain in both knee joint (right>Left) for 20 days. On examination, following finding seen. The probable diagnosis is:

A 70-year-old female presents with complaints of severe unilateral headache which is unresponsive to anti-migraine treatment. She also reports myalgia with low grade fever and weight loss. She is most likely suffering from:
An 80 years old man with past history of AMI is found to have LBBB on ECG. He is asymptomatic; on cardiac auscultation the most likely finding is?
Each of the following heart sounds occurs shortly after S2, except?
questions.correct_answer: D. Click of mitral valve prolapse

questions.text: Interpret the following ABG: ph – 7.23 PaCO2 – 70 mm HCO3 – 25 mEq

A 25-year-old man with a 6-year history of HIV-AIDS complicated recently by PCP was treated with high dose Co-Trimoxazole. On day 4 of treatment, the following laboratory data was obtained as follows: Na+ -135, K+-6.5, Cl-110, HCO3-15, pH-7.30, BUN-14, Creatinine-0.9, Plasma Osmolarity - 268. What is the diagnosis?
Interpret the following ABG: ph – 7.20 PaO2 – 69mm PaCO2 – 30 mm HCO3 – 15 mEq

options.label: A
options.text: Metabolic Acidosis with Compensatory respiratory Alkalosis

options.label: B
options.text: Metabolic Acidosis with Additional Respiratory Acidosis

options.label: C
options.text: Metabolic Acidosis with Additional Respiratory Alkalosis

options.label: D
options.text: Respiratory alkalosis with compensatory metabolic acidosis

questions.correct_answer: A. Metabolic Acidosis with Compensatory respiratory Alkalosis

questions.text: An 84-year-old female was found to have a blood pressure of 85/60 mmHg, heart rate 101beats/min, temperature 37.8°C. Laboratory data are obtained: sodium 137 meq/L, potassium 2.8meq/L, HCO3 10 meq/L, chloride 117 meq/L, BUN 17 mg/dL, creatinine 0.9 mg/dL. An arterial blood gas shows PaO2 80 mmHg, PCO2 24 mmHg, pH 7.29. Her urine analysis is clear and has a Ph of 4.5. What is the acid-base disorder?

options.label: B
options.text: Normal–anion-gap metabolic acidosis + High anion gap acidosis

options.label: C
options.text: Normal–anion-gap metabolic acidosis and compensatory respiratory alkalosis

questions.correct_answer: C. Normal–anion-gap metabolic acidosis and compensatory respiratory alkalosis

questions.text: Which of the following is a cause of Lactic Acidosis- Type A?
Identify the false statement about Pulmonary arterial hypertension

options.label: A
options.text: Idiopathic PAH is more common in middle aged females

options.label: B
options.text: Pulmonary capillary wedge pressure is > 20mm of Hg

options.label: C
options.text: PAH is a dreaded manifestation causing mortality in Scleroderma patients

options.label: D
options.text: Prostacyclin analogues are first line therapy for PAH with Heart failure

questions.correct_answer: B. Pulmonary capillary wedge pressure is > 20mm of Hg

questions.text: Riociguat is used in the treatment of Pulmonary hypertension. Its Mechanism of action is:
Which test will be normal in chronic pancreatic insufficiency?

A 46-year-old woman with scleroderma presents with diarrhoea, bloating and weight loss. Colonoscopy is normal with no abnormality found on biopsy histology. Coeliac serology is negative, thyroid function normal and stool culture negative. Bacterial overgrowth is suspected. Which will not be the expected finding in this clinical scenario?

options.label: D
options.text: Urine D xylose 5.5 gm in D xylose test.

questions.correct_answer: D. Urine D xylose 5.5 gm in D xylose test.

questions.text: A 23 year old woman presents with 8-month history of bloating, loose stool and bowel-opening frequency of 3 times per day. There is no weight loss. Blood tests reveal a haemoglobin of 10.8 g/dL, a ferritin of 7 µg/L and a folate of 1 µg/L and are otherwise normal. What is the next best investigation?

options.label: D
options.text: Symptomatic treatment as she is a case of irritable bowel syndrome.

questions.text: A 50-year-old man presents with diarrhoea, low-grade fever and joint pains. A colonoscopy is normal. Biopsies from the terminal ileum reveal the presence of foamy macrophages. What is the appropriate management?

options.label: A
options.text: Two weeks of intravenous ceftriaxone, then oral antibiotics for 1 year

options.label: D
options.text: No treatment is required – symptoms usually settle spontaneously

questions.correct_answer: A. Two weeks of intravenous ceftriaxone, then oral antibiotics for 1 year
